titles: Directions for damosels, or The maidens advice, in an answer to the young mens counseller. You that a kind good husband lack let me with you prevail, to choose a brown or curious black, these colours never fail. Tune of, All trades. This may be printed R.P.
publisher: Printed for J. Deacon, at the Angel in Guiltspur-street, without Newgate.,
notes: Verse: "O now I have counsell'd young-men ..."
Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library and the British Library.
